title: Reverse String
patternTriggers: Use String Reversal when reversing character sequences. Key indicators: reverse string, reverse array, swap characters, mirror sequence, LIFO order.

approaches.name: Two Pointers (Optimal)
approaches.intuition: Use two pointers from both ends, swap characters and move towards center. Most efficient for in-place reversal. No extra space needed beyond pointers.
approaches.approach: Start pointers at beginning and end. Swap characters and move pointers inward until they meet.

complexity.timeExplanation: Visit each character once for swapping. Total: O(n) where n is string length.
complexity.spaceExplanation: Only use two pointer variables. No additional data structures. Space: O(1).

approaches.name: Stack (Alternative)
approaches.intuition: Use stack's LIFO property. Push all characters, then pop to get reversed order. Natural reversal using stack semantics.
approaches.approach: Push all characters onto stack. Pop characters and place back into array/string.
steps: Push all characters from string onto stack

complexity.timeExplanation: Push n characters: O(n). Pop n characters: O(n). Total: O(n).
complexity.spaceExplanation: Stack stores all n characters. Space: O(n).

commonMistakes: Creating new string instead of in-place reversal
Not handling empty or single character strings
Swapping characters that have already been swapped
Not moving both pointers after swap
Checking left <= right instead of left < right
Using recursion without tail call optimization (stack overflow)
Forgetting to handle Unicode characters properly
hints: Two pointers from ends is most efficient
Swap and move inward until pointers meet
Can also use recursion but watch stack space
Built-in reverse functions often use two pointers
